abstract: Mr. Safer was on the CBS show for 46 years, and as a TV correspondent brought the horrors of the Vietnam War into America’s living rooms.
snippet: Mr. Safer was on the CBS show for 46 years, and as a TV correspondent brought the horrors of the Vietnam War into America’s living rooms.
lead_paragraph: Morley Safer, a CBS television correspondent who brought the horrors of the Vietnam War into the living rooms of America in the 1960s and was a mainstay of the network’s newsmagazine “60 Minutes” for almost five decades, died on Thursday at his home in Manhattan. He was 84.

headline.main: Morley Safer, Mainstay of ‘60 Minutes,’ Is Dead at 84
headline.print_headline: Morley Safer, Chronicler of Vietnam and Mainstay of ‘60 Minutes,’ Dies at 84
